comment: She seemed concerned about how well you do in the class but she is completely biased in her grading. She holds conferences at the end of semester where she tells you your likely grade but ends up giving you something else. I do not like her grading style and regretted taking her class. She killed my GPA. Take her only if u are a good writer already

Heather Dahn (formerly Smith) is one of the best professors I've ever had the pleasure of having. Witty and incisive commentary in class with good discussions plus an honest and straightforward teaching style make her a blessing to the English Department. Very tough grader, but very fair and makes it crystal clear what's expected of you.

(AKA Heather Danh- she got married.) She's definitely a tough teacher, and I do understand these mixed reviews. I enjoyed her class because I'm a relatively decent writer. Just listen to her lectures, prepare your work by the deadlines, turn in a rough draft of your papers to her, and learn how to use proper English.
Do not take her! She will not help you and her grading is completely bias. She always comes into class mad at something so she takes it out on you, and your grades.

Professor Smith is a great! She actually grades your papers and lets you know what you did wrong. She's always there to help you with topics and her in class discussions are hilarious. I loved them. I would recommend her to anyone.

I think she is an excellent teacher. She is always willing to help. Her grading scale is crystal clear, and she lets you know exactly what you did wrong on your essay so you can fix it later. Overall, this was a very helpful class and it improved my writing.

Professor Smith really does enjoy teaching and you can tell she wants nothing more but to help you! She does grade hard, but it ultimately teaches you to be a better writer. Her grading system works in your favor. She is funny & her class is enjoyable. DO THE READINGS AND TURN THINGS IN ON TIME! She will tell you to leave. DEf. would recommenend!

When I asked for help she replied with "are you joking?",  When she is presenting course work she treats her students like they don't know anything and are all idiots.  I felt very disrespected in her class.

Do not fret if you get Cs on your papers.  The grading scale for the class is structured so that you can still get an A by completing in-class assignments.  She is a stickler for attendance, but will work with students who speak with her prior to missing class.  If you pay attention and put effort into peer editing, you WILL become a better writer.

She knows how to teach and it's entirely possible to learn from her. She's a bit intimidating and has a bit of a temper... but nothing unbearable. Very reasonable grader. Does a LOT of peer editing sessions. The paper topics are very open ended and allow for creativity.

Professor Smith KNOWS how to teach. All of the assignments and techniques used in class really help you to become a better writer. She loves teaching the class and therefore attending class is engaging and rewarding. Just remember to work hard and come prepared.

Picks difficult subjects to write on and grades papers hard. However, if you ask her a question she will take time to explain and makes sure you understand. She makes herslef very available to her students if they are having problems. MAKE SURE YOU READ WHEN READING IS ASSIGNED!

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. She assigns papers, but doesn't specify what she wants. She'll say "write a paper on education" and then not say what she means. She's an extremely hard grader and doesn't give constructive criticism. She would just cross things out on papers and write "WRONG", but then not explain why it was wrong. She's not helpful at ALL!
